In a very large build environment, we had one developer move a feature from 
version 3.0.0 to 3.0.1
Unfortunately, there was a separate feature which had a "require" statement 
looking for version 3.0.0
The error messages are copied below.
This was running the build in a headless mode from the command line.
Because we had no mechanism to determine where the break occurred, and because 
the build is not tolerant of this sort of thing, our production development 
environment was down for three days.
We need either a more robust build tool, or better diagnostic messages so we 
can diagnose and fix this sort of problem.
Alternatively a "prescreen" step would be very useful.
